parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To raise up, set up; I rise from among (the) dead; I arise, appear. From ana and histemi; to stand up.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Passive - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To travel, journey, go, die.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
From oikos; properly, residence, but usually an abode; by implication, a family.
Of Hebrew origin; Judas, the name of ten Israelites; also of the posterity of one of them and its region.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Perhaps from eu and tithemi; straight, i.e. level, or true; adverbially at once.
A narrow street or lane in a town or city. Prolongation from rhoumai in its original sense; an alley or avenue.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To seek, search for, desire, require, demand. Of uncertain affinity; to seek; specially, to worship, or to plot.
Belonging to Tarsus, a Tarsian. From Tarsos; a Tarsean, i.e. Native of Tarsus.
Name, character, fame, reputation. From a presumed derivative of the base of ginosko; a 'name'.
Saul, the apostle. Of Hebrew origin, the same as Saoul; Saulus, the Jewish name of Paul.
For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: See! Lo! Behold! Look! Second person singular imperative middle voice of eido; used as imperative lo!

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To pray, pray for, offer prayer. From pros and euchomai; to pray to God, i.e. Supplicate, worship.
